captions.text: Abou and Kamal were lucky enough to gain trials. Kamal was with Nottingham Forest.
Teams have shown interesting because I've been a consistent player throughout the season.
The same as Abou, he had a trial at Notts County. Everything went well at Notts County, I played 2 friendly games with them.
Abou has become a box-to-box player which was the kind of thing that we were demanding from him.
We have a game on Tuesday against AFC Wimbledon, and we're playing in London.
Do your best, beat them and see whether an opportunity arises from the game.
Either from the opposition or from any scout that comes to see our game because the dream might be there, tomorrow.
Games like this towards the end of the season, last 4 or 5 weeks, for the players are crucial. Results can't change anything now,
Teams are either in promotion places, relegation places or mid-table. So what they're looking for now is next year.
Players have to realize that they're watched, in everything that they do.
I would like to see, from Abou, Kamal and from the rest of the squad, the same commitment and determination they've shown since day one.
For the first 5 or 10 minutes, they're going to press, so be clever. As the match progresses, we'll have a chance to play our game.
They're competitive; they're fit, and well organized. So they're not easy to break down.
Kamal is pushing up a little bit too high, too early. Abou needs to link a little bit better with Webby.
Both sides are trying to dictate the tempo: The Nike Academy are looking to play through the thirds on the floor.
AFC Wimbledon are a little bit more direct. For example, there: Kamal was lively to it. He's a bright defender! He's doing very well.
For me, you are much better than them. Abou -- better, as the game progressed you were much better.
But the first 10 minutes, we are still not there. He fouled you a few times,
and you were out of the game for a few minutes, that can't happen. Good luck.
Abou won a number of headers in front of the center halves, and he won a number of tackles.
His game is all about winning the ball, playing forward and then getting forward. That is his game, he's a Patrick Vieira type.
I can see that he has a very good chance to make it in the professional game.
Kamal finished the season very well. Unfortunately nothing was finalized but we have great hopes
that once he comes back in pre-season, he's going to maintain that level and those kind of performances.
I gave it my all and I am disappointed not to have signed a contract.
Unfortunately he fell slightly short of going into the first team, and they were looking for first team players rather than under 21's.
We will definitely come back stronger next season, with one objective in mind to sign a pro contract.
During the holidays we will work hard as well as we have our programme to follow,
which will help us to improve our strength and condition next season.
